intro: Cecropia hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras ceiba, is a fast-growing tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and elongated, light-green leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Cecropia hondurensis plays an important ecological role in tropical forests, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
